locutie.beschrijving: A Good Friday meditation on the Gospel of John, focusing on the substitutionary nature of Christ's death, the victory over the devil, and the reliability of the biblical witness.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher engages with the specific vocabulary of John (the Jews, the hour, tetelestai) and uses intertextuality (Hebrews/Psalms).

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from explaining the text (Asserting) to inviting the congregation into the reality of the cross (Promising/Directing).

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort, assurance of forgiveness, and a renewed trust in the biblical narrative.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Yes, explicitly mentions the Holy Spirit showing the church what Jesus says.

voorbeelden: John sometimes seems to use the term 'the Jews' to mean religious authorities.
The Father has given power to the Son.
It is the highest privilege of the year for me to be here.
We wouldn't want to be too literal-minded.
If the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.
He gives power to become children of God.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly biblical, though often framed as quotes rather than direct 'I' promises from the preacher.

voorbeelden: I it was denied thee: I crucified thee (quoted as confession).
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the text to declare reality rather than using first-person sacerdotal declarations.

indicatoren: Extensive discussion on the term 'the Jews'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually convinced but remains an observer for the first 80% of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct first-person commissives (I promise you in His name)
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is delayed until the very end.

voorbeelden: He has taken you into his heart.
He gives power to become children of God.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's privilege, 'we' as a community of trust.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address in the conclusion and application of the Psalms.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used heavily in the final 'Believe tonight' section.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, John, the Jews, and scholars.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the middle section.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the history of the cross (Assertive) to the personal promise (Commissive) to the call to believe (Directive).
voorbeelden: He becomes the Lamb (Assertive) -> He has taken you into his heart (Commissive) -> Believe tonight (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: As the Father has loved him, so has he loved us; dear friends, abide in his love.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a masterful blend of teaching and comfort, though it spends significant time defending the text against modern skepticism.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: 'Twas I, Lord Jesus, I it was denied thee.
sterke_punten.effect: Collapses the distance between the hearer and the cross.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: We will not conceal from you tonight that there are numerous Biblical scholars...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Breaks the performative flow of the liturgy to argue with absent critics.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The ending transforms the sermon into an event, but the middle is largely informational.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts more as a witness to the Word than a direct channel of the 'I forgive you' declaration.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, Christ is described as the living Lord who speaks to the church.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is a living Lord who has shown to the church by the Holy Spirit what he says.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the one who facilitates the presence of Christ.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher calls for belief but acknowledges it as a response to the 'presence'.
tekstueel_bewijs: shown to the church by the Holy Spirit

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to give 'life in his name'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Moderate. Strongest in the final paragraph.
tekstueel_bewijs: Take him into your heart and your life as he has taken you into his heart.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'says' (descriptive). It needs more 'I give' and 'You are' (performative).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The purpose of this sacrificial death... is to take away the sin of the world.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, this Lamb of God takes away your sin.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general theological fact to a present-tense event for the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promises are mostly quoted from scripture rather than spoken directly by the preacher to the people.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more 'I' (as Christ's ambassador) to 'You' language.
voorbeeldzinnen: In Christ's name, I tell you: your sins are carried to the cross.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is good, though the indicative is very long.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Shorten the apologetic section to allow the indicative of grace more room to breathe.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply theological and moving sermon that successfully culminates in a performative encounter, despite a heavy constative middle section.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a 'message' about God, but that the words themselves (the Commissives) are the vehicle of God's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The analysis focuses not on how 'moving' the story of the cross is, but on whether the preacher actually *delivers* the promise to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the section on biblical scholars is a 'locutionary detour' that stalls the 'illocutionary force' of the Good Friday event.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: It is important that we be aware of this.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Homiletics' where the preacher's high view of Scripture leads to a surplus of 'talking about' the text's reliability.
